trial_identification.studytitle: The effect of position modification on Intra-ocular pressure, during Robotic Assisted Laparoscopic Radical Prostatectomy - A Randomized control study.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effect of "Modified Z" Trendelenburg Positioning on Intra-ocular pressure, during Robotic Assisted Laparoscopic Radical Prostatectomy - A Randomized control study.

conditions.healthcondition: Intra ocular pressure change, during long head down positioning - which may lead to diminish venous drainage, reduce oxygenation and nerve compression that may result in ocular complication (visual loss).

interventions.interventions: We change the patient's position during robotic assisted laparoscopic radical prostatectomy by using the standard head down trendelenburg position with elevating the head and shoulder to horizontal level and named it; "Modified Z" Trendelenburg position. IOP, blood pressure and endotracheal Co2 - measured at the induction of anaesthesia in supine, before positioning, head down, after that group 1 patients have thier head and shoulders in modified horizontal position. All patients will have those parameters checked also after pneumo-peritoneum and every 30 minutes, at the end of the operation all patients will be in horizontal supine position, with IOP checked at cease of pneumo-peritoneum, and before awakening. The surgery was not changed as a result of the positioning modification.
interventions.comparator: Patients in the control group, went through the operation in the standard trendelenburg position; head down 23 degrees.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Intra Ocular pressure was measured in anasthesised patients, using a hand-held tonometer (TONO-PEN AVIATM, Tonometer. Reichert).
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Intra ocular pressure - measure at the start of anaesthesia, each time the positioning changes and every 30 minute during the operation, until cease of anaesthesia.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Blood pressure was monitored and recorded by the anasthetic mechine, using blood pressure cuff at the left patient's arm.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Blood pressure, measure at the start of anaesthesia, each time the positioning changes and every 30 minute during the operation, until cease of anaesthesia.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: All patients schedule for robotic radical prostatectomy.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Eye operation in the last 3 weeks

ethicsAndSummary.summary: We modify the positioning of patients going under robot-assisted laparoscopic radical prostatectomy, with head and shoulder in horizontal positioning and compare their intra ocular pressure to patients in standard position; 23 degree head-down trendelenburg.
